alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Hampden; Hampshire; Worcester (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 26 at 2:46PM EDT until August 26 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR WEST CENTRAL WORCESTER, SOUTHEASTERN FRANKLIN, CENTRAL HAMPDEN AND SOUTHEASTERN HAMPSHIRE COUNTIES... At 246 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated that the initial thunderstorms that moved across the region resulted in widespread 1 to 2 inches of rain. There was a temporary lull in the activity, but additional showers and thunderstorms are expected to move into the region over the next hour or two. This coupled with the earlier heavy rain may result in the potential for flash flooding. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Springfield, Chicopee, Westfield, Holyoke, Amherst, Agawam, West Springfield, Ludlow, South Hadley, Longmeadow, East Longmeadow, Belchertown, Wilbraham, Palmer, Ware, Monson, Granby, Southampton, Barre and West Brookfield. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
